channel.title: CVE Feed for PaperCut -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PaperCut -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-1222|2024-08-28T15:10:56.143Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This allows attackers to use a maliciously formed API request to gain access to an API authorization level with elevated privileges. This applies to a small subset of PaperCut NG/MF API calls.

item.title: CVE-2024-1884|2024-08-28T15:12:02.085Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This is a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in the PaperCut NG/MF server-side module that allows an attacker to induce the server-side application to make HTTP requests to an arbitrary domain of the attacker's choosing.

item.title: CVE-2024-4712|2024-08-01T20:47:41.691Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: An arbitrary file creation vulnerability exists in PaperCut NG/MF that only affects Windows servers with Web Print enabled. This vulnerability requires local login/console access to the PaperCut NG/MF server (eg: member of a domain admin group).

item.title: CVE-2024-3037|2024-08-01T20:42:25.605Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: An arbitrary file deletion vulnerability exists in PaperCut NG/MF that only affects Windows servers with Web Print enabled. This vulnerability requires local login/console access to the PaperCut NG/MF server (eg: member of a domain admin group).

item.title: CVE-2024-1223|2024-08-01T18:33:25.230Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This vulnerability potentially allows unauthorized enumeration of information from the embedded device APIs. An attacker must already have existing knowledge of some combination of valid usernames, device names and an internal system key. For such an attack to be successful the system must be in a specific runtime state.

item.title: CVE-2024-1882|2024-08-01T18:56:22.441Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This vulnerability allows an already authenticated admin user to create a malicious payload that could be leveraged for remote code execution on the server hosting the PaperCut NG/MF application server.

item.title: CVE-2024-1884|2024-08-01T18:56:22.318Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This is a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in the PaperCut NG/MF server-side module that allows an attacker to induce the server-side application to make HTTP requests to an arbitrary domain of the attacker's choosing.

item.title: CVE-2024-1222|2024-08-01T18:33:25.592Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This allows attackers to use a maliciously formed API request to gain access to an API authorization level with elevated privileges. This applies to a small subset of PaperCut NG/MF API calls.

item.title: CVE-2024-1221|2024-08-01T18:33:25.291Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This vulnerability potentially allows files on a PaperCut NG/MF server to be exposed using a specifically formed payload against the impacted API endpoint. The attacker must carry out some reconnaissance to gain knowledge of a system token. This CVE only affects Linux and macOS PaperCut NG/MF servers.

item.title: CVE-2024-1883|2024-08-01T18:56:22.271Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This is a reflected cross site scripting vulnerability in the PaperCut NG/MF application server. An attacker can exploit this weakness by crafting a malicious URL that contains a script. When an unsuspecting user clicks on this malicious link, it could potentially lead to limited loss of confidentiality, integrity or availability.

item.title: CVE-2024-1654|2024-08-01T18:48:21.853Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: This vulnerability potentially allows unauthorized write operations which may lead to remote code execution. An attacker must already have authenticated admin access and knowledge of both an internal system identifier and details of another valid user to exploit this.

item.title: CVE-2024-4712|2024-06-20T19:40:12.502Z -- papercut -- papercut%20ng%2C%20papercut%20mf
item.description: An arbitrary file creation vulnerability exists in PaperCut NG/MF that only affects Windows servers with Web Print enabled. This vulnerability requires local login/console access to the PaperCut NG/MF server (eg: member of a domain admin group).

item.description: This vulnerability potentially allows files on a PaperCut NG/MF server to be exposed using a specifically formed payload against the impacted API endpoint. The attacker must carry out some reconnaissance to gain knowledge of a system token. This CVE only affects Linux and macOS PaperCut NG/MF servers.

item.description: This vulnerability allows an already authenticated admin user to create a malicious payload that could be leveraged for remote code execution on the server hosting the PaperCut NG/MF application server.

item.description: This is a reflected cross site scripting vulnerability in the PaperCut NG/MF application server. An attacker can exploit this weakness by crafting a malicious URL that contains a script. When an unsuspecting user clicks on this malicious link, it could potentially lead to limited loss of confidentiality, integrity or availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-39469|2024-06-04T17:27:06.117Z -- papercut -- ng
item.description:
PaperCut NG External User Lookup Code Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PaperCut NG. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the External User Lookup functionality. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute Java code. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM. Was ZDI-CAN-21013.

item.description: This vulnerability allows an already authenticated admin user to create a malicious payload that could be leveraged for remote code execution on the server hosting the PaperCut NG/MF application server.

item.description:
PaperCut NG External User Lookup Code Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of PaperCut NG. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the External User Lookup functionality. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute Java code. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM. Was ZDI-CAN-21013.
